qas.question: In what year did the name Sony Music Entertainment become the new name of Sony's record label?
In what year did CBS Associated become Epic Associated?
What is the only country where Sony has no rights to the Columbia label?
Who owns the rights to the Columbia label in Japan?
ABC renamed the record company SME on what date?
Renaming the company fulfilled the terms of the 1998 what?
The ABC Associated label was renamed what?

plausible_answers.text: to the Columbia name as it is controlled by Nippon Columbia

qas.question: China is the only country where Sony does not have the rights to what?
Berkman Music Group was a rightsholder from which country?

context: Sony renamed the record company Sony Music Entertainment (SME) on <b4_0>January 1, <a0_0><a1_0>1991<b4_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/>, fulfilling the terms set under the 1988 <b5_0>buyout<b5_0/>, which granted only a transitional license to the CBS trademark. The CBS Associated label was renamed <b6_0>Epic Associated<b6_0/>. Also on January 1, 1991, to replace the CBS label, Sony reintroduced the Columbia label worldwide, which it previously held in the United States and Canada only, after it acquired the international rights to the trademark from EMI in 1990. <a2_0>Japan<a2_0/> is the only country where Sony does not have rights <b7_0>to the Columbia name as it is controlled by <a3_0>Nippon Columbia<b7_0/><a3_0/>, an unrelated company. Thus, until this day, Sony Music Entertainment Japan does not use the Columbia trademark for Columbia label recordings from outside Japan which are issued in Japan. The Columbia Records trademark's rightsholder in <b8_0>Spain<b8_0/> was Bertelsmann Music Group, Germany, which Sony Music subsequently subsumed via a 2004 merger, followed by a 2008 buyout.
